definition: lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. old people may still cherish high aspirations
pinyin: lao3 ji4 fu2 li4 , zhi4 zai4 qian1 li3

pinyin: lao3 ji4 fu2 li4 , zhi4 zai4 qian1 li3

definition: old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years
treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
lit. a good sword always remains sharp (idiom)/fig. (of one's skills etc) to be as good as ever/the old man still has it
lit. spare valor for sale (idiom); fig. after former successes, still ready for more work/not resting on one's laurels
to admit to one's advancing years/to acquiesce to old age
